Package com.bluegosling.collections.concurrent

New implementations of concurrent data structures.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BlockingOrderedDeque<E>  
    ConcurrentList<E>
    A list that is thread-safe and supports concurrent mutations.
    ConcurrentStack<E>  
    SharedCapacityDequeFactory.CloseableBlockingDeque<T>
    A BlockingDeque that can be closed.
    SharedCapacityDequeFactory.CloseableBlockingQueue<T>
    A BlockingQueue that can be closed.
    SharedCapacityDequeFactory.CloseableDeque<T>
    A Deque that can be closed.
    SharedCapacityDequeFactory.CloseableQueue<T>
    A Queue that can be closed.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractLockFreeBlockingDeque<E>
    An abstract blocking deque, useful for building deque implementations that do not rely on locks for thread-safey.
    AbstractLockFreeBlockingOrderedDeque<E>  
    AbstractLockFreeBlockingQueue<E>
    An abstract blocking queue, useful for building queue implementations that do not rely on locks for thread-safety.
    ArrayBlockingDeque<E>
    A double-ended blocking queue backed by an array.
    ConcurrentSkipListOrderedQueue<E>  
    ConcurrentSortedArraySet<E>
    A NavigableSet that allows concurrent access.
    ConcurrentSortedArraySet.Builder<E>
    A builder class for constructing instances of ConcurrentSortedArraySet.
    DoubleInstanceLockedTreeMap<K,V>
    A concurrent navigable map backed by a TreeMap and made thread-safe via a DoubleInstanceLock.
    LockFreeArrayBlockingQueue<E>
    A blocking queue that is backed by an array and is lock-free.
    LockFreeLinkedBlockingDeque<E>
    A lock-free implementation of BlockingDeque, backed by a ConcurrentLinkedDeque.
    LockFreeLinkedBlockingQueue<E>
    A lock-free implementation of BlockingQueue, backed by a ConcurrentLinkedQueue.
    LockFreeSkipListBlockingQueue<E>
    A blocking ordered queue that uses a concurrent skip list to store elements.
    PersistentListBackedConcurrentList<E>  
    PersistentMapBackedConcurrentMap<K,V>
    A concurrent map that is backed by a persistent map.
    ShardedConcurrentSets
    This utility class provides concurrent set implementations that wrap normal (non-concurrent) sets to provide thread-safe access.
    ShardedConcurrentSets.Builder<E,T extends Set<E>>
    Creates concurrent set objects using the builder pattern.
    SharedCapacityDequeFactory
    A producer of queues and deques that all share a single bound.
    SimpleTreiberStack<T>
    A very simple, thread-safe stack.
    TreiberStack<T>
    A thread-safe stack.

Package com.bluegosling.collections.concurrent Description

New implementations of concurrent data structures.

This package contains several blocking queue and deque implementations that are lock-free. Under certain workloads, particularly where contention might arise (many consumers and/or many producers), these implementations may provide superior performance to the standard implementations included in the java.util.concurrent package (JSR 166).

There is also a factory class for instantiating concurrent sets. It operates using normal not-thread-safe set implementations and makes them thread-safe using sharding, for parallelism, and read-write locks, for thread-safety.

Also present are concurrent structures that use persistent collections and compare-and-swap. These include both a list (which implements a new ConcurrentList interface) and a map.
